title: Gullah/Geechee Cultural Heritage Corridor: Park Home
body: A Unique African American Culture  Designated by Congress in 2006, the Gullah Geechee Cultural Heritage Corridor extends from Wilmington, North Carolina in the north to Jacksonville, Florida in the south. It is home to one of America's most unique cultures, a tradition first shaped by captive Africans brought to the southern United States from West Africa and continued in later generations by their descendents. Read More             Mississippi Hills NHA   Mississippi Hills NHA one of 12 NHAs in the Southeast
